intro: Calendula persica var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender Persian marigold, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive central disc. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
